revision.text: This page provides some SBGN-ML example files created with LibSBGN. Examples 1 to 5 are based on the examples in the SBGN Process Description specification [[#1|[1]]]. == Glycolysis == This example illustrates how SBGN can be used to describe metabolic pathways. [[#1|[1]]] Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/glycolysis.sbgn glycolysis.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_Glycolysis.png|thumb|center|529px]] == Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF) signalling == This example shows the use of compartments and how details can be hidden by using a submap. The submap is shown in the next example. [[#1|[1]]] Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/insulin-like_growth_factor_signaling.sbgn insulin-like_growth_factor_signaling.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_Insulin-like_Growth_Factor_signalling.png|thumb|center|563px]] == MAPK cascade == A submap of the previous map showing the MAPK cascade. [[#1|[1]]] Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/mapk_cascade.sbgn mapk_cascade.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_MAPK_cascade.png|thumb|center|375px]] == Neuronal/Muscle signalling == A description of inter-cellular signalling using SBGN. [[#1|[1]]] Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/neuronal_muscle_signalling.sbgn neuronal_muscle_signalling.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_Neuronal_Muscle_signalling.png|thumb|center|455px]] == Activated STAT1alpha induction of the IRF1 gene == An example of gene regulation using logical operators. [[#1|[1]]] Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/activated_stat1alpha_induction_of_the_irf1_gene.sbgn activated_stat1alpha_induction_of_the_irf1_gene.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_Activated_STAT1alpha_induction_of_the_IRF1_gene.png|thumb|center|317px]] == Central plant metabolism == This is the representation of major parts of the central metabolism in monocotyledon plants. The information has been derived from the [http://metacrop.ipk-gatersleben.de MetaCrop] [[#2|[2]]] database, a manually curated repository of high quality information concerning the metabolism of crop plants. This includes pathways, reactions, locations, transport processes, and more. Download [https://libsbgn.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/libsbgn/tags/milestone1/example-files/central_plant_metabolism.sbgn central_plant_metabolism.sbgn] [[Image:LibSBGN_Central_plant_metabolism_small.png|thumb|center|663px]] [http://www.sbgn.org/images/8/80/LibSBGN_Central_plant_metabolism.png Full resolution‎] (5,891 × 3,791 pixels, file size: 1.46 MB) == References == [1] S. Moodie, N. Le Novere, E. Demir, H. Mi, and F. Schreiber. Systems Biology Graphical Notation: Process Description language Level 1. Available from Nature Precedings http://precedings.nature.com/documents/3721/version/2 (2010). [2] E. Grafahrend-Belau, S. Weise, D. Koschützki, U. Scholz, B. H. Junker, and F. Schreiber. [http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/full/36/suppl_1/D954 MetaCrop: a detailed database of crop plant metabolism]. Nucleic Acids Research, 36(Database issue):D954-D958 (2008).
